Reviews.Title: “Best ever”
Reviews.Author: Dennis B
Reviews.Content: First Wyndham I have ever stayed at, and it was incredible. We were there for a 2 1/2 day meeting which was meticulously looked after, the rooms were great, and the place had a very positive vibe.From the management to the desk to the amazing restaurant staff everyone was friendly, helpful and couldn't do enough for us.They were clearly happy to be working there.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: Mary H
Reviews.Content: Outstanding customer service and great attention to detail! The Hotel is close to the airport, with prompt shuttle service. The rooms were more than comfortable! I would highly recommend this Hotel to anyone who travels in and out of Love Field!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: James B
Reviews.Content: From the housekeeping staff, the front desk receptionists, the van drivers, to all of my "friends" in the restaurant, like any great business, the employees of this hotel make it a great place to stay. Rooms -- plenty of space, good wifi connection, comfortable bed, flat screen TV, coffee nook, microwave, fridge ... updated and clean. Quiet and comfortable. Spacious lobby with a Starbucks ... The restaurant has an awesome M-F quality lunch buffet that's hard to beat ... and a daily weekday happy hour that's most appreciated. From comfort food to salads, the restaurant has an appealing selection for just about everyone. I normally stay at Hilton Garden Inns when I travel .... but, this particular Wyndham ranks right up there with them all. In the Dallas Love area, this is my hotel of choice!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: sonya610
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and close to the airport. They have a shuttle that goes to the airport on demand and is very reliable! When they say they are on their way...they really are! The food & service in the bar in equally as fantastic and the prices are reasonable. Even though it's an airport property, the planes arriving & departing were not a problem. The black out curtains really help cut out the noise as well. I will definitely stay again whether its for business or pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: jenjen523
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was pretty nice. Customer service was just ok at the desk. The room was a nice size. The bathroom was nice. The was a clear shower door which is a nice change from the shower curtains. The room was clean. The only thing weird about the room was there was a pillar in the middle of the floor. I thought that was strange. If you got up in the middle of the night and forgot it was there, that could be dangerous. The only other crappy thing was that the referigerator was making a weird noise all night that kept me awake. When I mentioned it to the front desk at check-out, you can tell they didn't care. Overall, the airport is super close and the rooms were nice.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Andrew S
Reviews.Content: I had a meeting up in Dallas, and stayed here because the hotel that was closer was booked. I really enjoyed this place. They had complimentary happy hour and a breakfast buffet. Although the breakfast buffet was subpar. The room was clean and large. The bathroom had a high quality glass shower, which was a nice change of pace compared to most hotels. I really enjoyed my experience. The only down point was chasing a cockroach out of the room, which was honestly entertaining.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: walkinandrollin
Reviews.Content: We have now stayed at this hotel twice. Our nephew is in Dallas right now at Children's Medical Center, and we have needed a place to stay. The first time we booked, we picked the Wyndham because they had a great holiday special rate, and it was the cheapest around. We were amazed at the size of the room, and completely satisfied with the accessibility features of the handicapped room. Everything was clean and the service was good. The adjoining restaurant had good food. A few weeks later we came back to Dallas and had booked another hotel because it was a good price. That hotel had not honored our handicapped room reservation, and we were left scrambling to find another place to stay. My husband immediately call the Wyndham. They did have the handicapped room my husband needed available, and gave us a decent quote over the phone as to the price. When we checked in, we were given an even better rate! This hotel turned a stressful situation into a comfortable, affordable stay in, as our kids say, "A fancy hotel!"

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: buckeyeflyer
Reviews.Content: Quick access to LUV field, starbucks in the lobby and sports bar has great service.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, cavernously large room”
Reviews.Author: edustin
Reviews.Content: Overnighted here awaiting morning flight at Love Field...a very comfy bed in a cavernously LARGE room, with a correspondingly grossly over-sized shower. I'm sure NBA players probably love it, but the rooms took a long time to warm up and feel comfy...an important factor on a night with pouring & freezing rain. Nicely attired restaurant offered a very tasty apple, walnut & cheese salad which I schlepped back to the (now warm) room. Staff very friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: Charles O
Reviews.Content: I had to stay at the Wyndham Dallas Love Field while attending a training class. We used the Concourse meeting room which was completely suitable for our needs and quite comfortable. I was thrilled to see a comfortable chair in my room that had a spot for my laptop to plug right into my chair - so convenient! The staff was quite friendly and the entire sales office came out and introduced themselves to me. If I need to stay in Dallas again, I will stay there. Best take away - it is so centrally located and downtown was literally a hop and a skip away.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: Soonersports
Reviews.Content: This is the second time since July that we've stayed at a Wyndham hotel (1st was Denver). If given a choice, I will always choose Wydnham from now on!!! Thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay-Spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: MandaRed
Reviews.Content: Traveled with a family of 4 for the weekend. The lobby was beautiful. At the front desk they offered cold Lemonade upon arrival. Which was nice. The room was spacious, It smelled/looked clean. The fridge smelled like mold. The room was hot but did not take long to cool off. Our bathroom was spacious and had a shower only, which I didnt mind we dont like using bathtubs at hotels anyways. We stayed on the 5th floor. The air plane noises were as bad as expected. We all slept well. The beds were comfy but the pillows were too stiff for my liking. Althought we didnt use the pool they offered towels at the front desk. The pool looked clean. Hotel was not the best location for the places we visited thru-out Dallas but for the price that made up for it. Recommend this hotel for any group. Pleasant stay-Would return in the near future. Oh did not use the fitness center nor ate at resturant.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: vjurban
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for numerious business trips. Each time we were treated like royalty.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: thebratrani
Reviews.Content: I love staying at the Wyndham! I am always treated like royalty by by all the staff, from the front desk personnel, bartender, restaurant staff, Room Director all the way to the General Manager. My room is always spotless, the guest fruit and cheese platter always beautiful. I feel like family when I'm there and would never consider staying anywhere else. The chef's food creations are always delicious. I would definitely give this hotel a 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, Great customer service, but NOISEY!!”
Reviews.Author: Butterfrog
Reviews.Content: Great Breakfast buffet- make sure to ask for what's not on the buffet, but included in price. Housekeeping comes around early (7am at my room) - make sure to put 'do not desturb' sign Great Beds, very comfy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice job again Wyndham!!!”
Reviews.Author: collegstation
Reviews.Content: review from an attendee at the meeting.. Faye was very responsive. Love the free wireless throughout the hotel (so did the attendees) Room set up was good Food was good Problems: Had to ask for registration table Breakfast was set up in meeting room and since we didnâ€™t have a full break, they didnâ€™t clear the food out of the room. We had to smell bacon throughout our morning

Reviews.Title: “What a excellant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: golfer77041
Reviews.Content: From check-in to departure it was a wonderful experience. Freindly staff through out the hotel. Clean rooms and great food.

Reviews.Title: “Great to work with”
Reviews.Author: AEdwards10
Reviews.Content: I hold small meetings with this property several times a year. The staff is always a delight to work with, not to mention very accommodating. It's also very convenient to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Your quality of service, staff, food and the facility is Superior.”
Reviews.Author: jjones7
Reviews.Content: Oh my goodness!!! You guys did an outstanding job once again. There is nothing at all I would suggestion changing. Iâ€™ve never been so pleased with such remarkable service and the royal treatment we received. The food was superior, the banquet room is always setup beautiful and clean. And, the guest room was clean, spacious, and a cozy feel at home setup. I truly appreciate all that you and your staff did, because not for once did I worry about anything. Weâ€™ve used your hotel for about three years now and each person who attended our brunch left with nothing but pleasant things to say. I can tell you of horrific, shocking, poor and unpleasant experience weâ€™ve received from the Renaissance Hotel and Marriott Market Center and long ago The Adolphus Hotel. So, I send a salute to you for a job well done. If there was a rating I could give you and your staff, it would be A+++++++++++++++. Thank you so much for making our event Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ramboc
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. I have been staying here since 2007 on a yearly basis and the general manager, Jeremy Millar, and his staff are some of the most professional and pleasant people that you would ever want to meet. They make you feel welcome the second you walk through the door. And kudos to Jeremy and Colin who always goe out of their way to make certain that my group and I have what we need. The breakfast buffet is one of the best I have ever seen. They switch it up a little each day which makes it interesting. I only have great things to say about the leadership and staff at this hotel and again highly recommend it for your visit to Dallas. You will not be sorry. Rambo

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL HOTEL! FRIENDLY STAFF AND CLEAN ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: TRB710625
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel twice for business, and each time the staff were friendly and the rooms were clean and comfortable. I am very picky about the smell of a hotel room once I enter, and each time I stayed at the Wyndham the rooms were clean and fresh smelling. The bathrooms & showers are very spacious. The beds are super comfortable and so are the lines (very white sheets/pillowcases). I noticed these specifics because I cannot sleep if the sheets are not clean smelling, or the colors are not vibrant. The restaurant (the Sports Grill) located in hotel serve good food and have good prices! They're opened until midnight, so if you have a late check-in you can always find something to eat. Breakfast is also served in this restaurant in the morning, also good service and good prices. The airport shuttle (LUV Field) runs every 30 minutes, and it's free. Very convenient location!!

Reviews.Title: “Room Fine...Restaurant terrible!”
Reviews.Author: Cynhoff
Reviews.Content: I am shocked that the restaurant got such good reviews. I ate there twice & both times it was unbelievably bad! Without a car, options were limited. The french fries were raw, the toasted bread was burnt & they do not have enough service personnel. The asian salad had huge blocks of carrots & dressing that was terrible! My room was clean & comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the Great Reviews”
Reviews.Author: jooksing
Reviews.Content: I have not stayed at Wyndam in many years and this stay made me reconsider my hotel choices. The hotel location is convenient. Both the hotel and restaurant staff were excellent. Room condition was excellent and bedding was very good. The overall value was very good to excellent

Reviews.Title: “Great place great rooms loved it”
Reviews.Author: Pgagne3
Reviews.Content: Great place great rooms loved it

Reviews.Title: “Truly Impressive hotel for the price...”
Reviews.Author: diaperchanger01
Reviews.Content: My children and I stayed at this hotel with my mother for our trip to DFW for medical purposes. The lobby of this hotel is spectacular. The rooms are spacious and the shower is a place I would like to live in! :) I found the entire stay excellent. The shuttle driver even took us to the airport, parked out by the runway and allowed my young children to watch planes land and take off! Where else would you find that kind of service! It was wonderful, thank you Wyndham Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Priceline gem!”
Reviews.Author: upwardtech
Reviews.Content: I'm always nervous about using name you own price, especially for business trips where I rely on shuttle service to get me around, so I was concerned that this property was a little further away from the Dallas Market Center (where I needed to go every day) than I would like it to be. However, the rate I got was only $50(!) so I figured I would rent a car if the shuttle service let me down and still come out ahead of what I would spend if I booked a room the "normal" way. Well, everything was much, much better than I expected and I would definitely stay here again. The rooms were very nice and clean with flat screen TVs. The restaurant/bar had excellent food and I would go there just for the food again. The drinks were very cheap as well. It appeared that most of the people staying here were related to the airlines and the shuttle service was mainly there to get them to and from the airport (directly across the street). But I had no difficultly getting around and the staff seemed to go out of their way to accommodate me. I needed to pick up a few things at the nearby Target one night and my transportation was handled very courteously. If I had to list the worst thing about this property, I would have to say it is the surrounding area. There isn't much around and what is there is old and run down strip clubs and convenience stores. It didn't seem unsafe, just kinda barren and blah. This really wasn't an issue for me as I was at a trade show all day and then simply came back to eat and sleep, but don't stay here if you are looking for some fun stuff to do within walking distance (unless of course you are in to the seedy strip club scene). So I was very happy with my stay and hopefully will stay here again in 6 months.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice restaurant with excellent food and service”
Reviews.Author: klakla56
Reviews.Content: Me and my colleagues eat at the Sports Page Grill on a regular basis and find it to be excellent food with excellent service. The entire hotel is very nice with supurb ammenities. I would recommend anyone stay here as they also have free shuttle service and is conveniently located right by Love Field Airport. Superb!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing restaurant!!!”
Reviews.Author: edwedw42
Reviews.Content: One time we were out by love field and needed a place to eat nearby so selected the restaurant at this hotel (Sports Page Grill). They have an amazing buffet at lunch and a very diverse menu ... very good food and not the 'typical' so-so hotel food that you get at other hotels. The staff was very friendly and the costs are very reasonable ... since then, we have came back hundreds of times for lunch since we work somewhat nearby. Would recommend this to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “An okay place with some positives and a few negatives”
Reviews.Author: AdvisorKing
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Wyndham Dallas â€“ Love Field for an extended weekend. We booked the hotel through Priceline, which caused us some problems (described below). We also booked in August, not realizing that the weekend we were booking for was the same weekend as the Texas-OU college football game that draws massive numbers of visitors to Dallas. I believe this property was recently converted from a Holiday Inn. If you look up the address on Google Street View, you will see the Holiday Inn sign rather than the Wyndham sign. We booked through Priceline and paid $283.36 for three nights, including taxes and cancellation insurance of $5 per night. The effective nightly rate including taxes but excluding the insurance was just under $90. On booking, I requested a room with two beds (since I was travelling alone with my teenage daughter). On the morning of our trip, I called the hotel, which indicated it could not accommodate our request for two beds. At the airport, before departing, I called Priceline and asked them whether they could solve the problem. But they were unwilling to provide any assistance and simply reminded me that they make no guarantees about the type of room. The obvious conclusion from this is that if the type of room is important to you (e.g., a father travelling with a teenage daughter looking for two beds), you should not book through Priceline. As this was my first experience booking a room through Priceline, I was left with an extremely bad taste in my mouth. But none of this was the hotelâ€™s fault and when we arrived, they offered (and we accepted) to have a rollaway cot brought to our room. The cot was more than adequate and the room type ceased to be any cause for concern. There are some good things about the Wyndham Dallas â€“ Love Field. It is conveniently located adjacent to Dallas Love Field airport, which is the airport used by Southwest Airlines. We flew into DFW, so proximity to Love Field wasnâ€™t any benefit. But if you were flying into Love Field, it would be very convenient. The hotel is also relatively close to everything in Dallas that we wanted to see. Iâ€™d guess it was about a 10-15 minute drive to get to the edge of downtown. The hotel provided ample free parking and also had free wireless internet connection. I usually 8itch about having to pay for an internet connection, so I like to acknowledge properties that donâ€™t â€œnickel and dimeâ€� you for these things. The room itself was fairly standard and perhaps slightly above average in terms of spaciousness. The bathrooms had probably been redone recently because the shower was a 6â€™ X 3â€™ wall-to-wall, floor-to-ceiling glass-walled enclosure with tile walls. The room had a medium-size LCD TV, which we never watched, a bar-sized fridge and a safe. The hotel staff were always friendly and we never felt hassled by housekeeping staff, even though we never left our room much before noon. On the first night there, we managed to order room service around 11:30 pm, even though their posted room-service hours ended at 11:00 pm. There was some noise from the airport during the day, but I never noticed it at night (or in the early morning) and suspect that they donâ€™t permit flights in or out of Love Field at night. On the negative side, I thought the room had a very strong smell to it. My daughter didnâ€™t think so, but I thought it bordered on overpowering until you got used to it. Iâ€™m not sure what it was â€“ maybe a chemical cleaner smell. The hotel is also in a slightly industrial looking stretch, across the street from the airport, next to an Enterprise (Rent a Car) and with a few other industrial-type properties nearby. On the first morning we went out to our rental car to find that the window had been smashed and the portable GPS stolen from the car. I reported it to the hotel, which had me fill out an incident report. They were relatively pleasant about it, but didnâ€™t make any notable effort to do anything to assist me or offset the damage and loss. I appreciate that they are not responsible for loss or damage. But they certainly didnâ€™t do anything to make me feel better about having a car broken into and personal items stolen while on their property. I reported the theft and damage to the police, which sent officers to attend and take a statement. It took about an hour from the time we discovered the damage until we were on our way and another hour to return the car to DFW and pick up a replacement. The incident didnâ€™t cause us too much grief. There will be some crime in every large city and youâ€™re bound to experience it eventually. It didnâ€™t cause any major inconveniences for us and, in some ways, was just part of the adventure. The hotel has a sports-bar type restaurant, which would normally be fine for me. However, we didnâ€™t discover that until the second night, when we wanted to have a â€œfancyâ€� dinner, so we had to look elsewhere for a nice place to eat. The Wyndham Dallas â€“ Love Field is an acceptable property. If I was flying in and out of Love Field, Iâ€™d probably stay there without spending much time looking around. However, if I was planning another visit to Dallas, I would likely look around for a more upscale place to stay. Also, given the break-in and theft from our car, my recommendation for this hotel would be particularly qualified.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and 24 hr shuttle to Love Field”
Reviews.Author: retiredlady07
Reviews.Content: Stayed here July 14th and the hotel is so nice. We only needed one night and parking for an 8 day trip. The bed was very comfortable, the room large and very clean. We could not find a hotel that shuttle service started before 7:00 a.m. and finally called the Wyndham and their shuttle service is 24 hrs. So glad to have found this hotel. This will be our hotel anytime we need one in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Incompetent Staff”
Reviews.Author: susan822
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the shuttle pick up and sat there for 20 minutes, called and they said they had never been called, that someone would be there in 15 minutes, 30 minutes later the bus drives by and never stops, I call the front desk for the 3rd time and they are non responsive, 1 1/2 hours later they picked us up, no apologies, nothing. The rooms are noisy and they place is run by people that do not care!! Don't stay here!

HotelInfo.Name: Wyndham Dallas Love Field
HotelInfo.Address: 3300 West Mockingbird Lane, Dallas, TX 75235
